tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customer_sales (
    customer_id INT,
    purchase_date DATE,
    purchase_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
    product_id INT,
    product_category VARCHAR(50)
);
CREATE TABLE Customer ( customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_name VARCHAR(255), customer_email VARCHAR(255), customer_phone VARCHAR(20) );
CREATE TABLE Product ( product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name VARCHAR(255), product_category VARCHAR(50), price DECIMAL(10, 2) );
CREATE TABLE PurchaseHistory ( purchase_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_id INT, purchase_date TIMESTAMP, product_id INT, quantity INT );

CREATE TABLE orders (
    order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    product_id INT NOT NULL,
    order_date DATE NOT NULL,
    quantity INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES products(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sales (
    sales_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    order_id INT NOT NULL,
    revenue DECIMAL(12, 2) NOT NULL,
    discount DECIMAL(5, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (order_id) REFERENCES orders(order_id)
);
CREATE TABLE customers (customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_name STRING, customer_email STRING, signup_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE purchases (purchase_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_id INT, purchase_date DATE, total_amount DECIMAL);
CREATE TABLE products (product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name STRING, category STRING, price DECIMAL);
CREATE TABLE orders (order_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_id INT, order_date DATE, status STRING);
CREATE TABLE sales_trends (trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY, trend_date DATE, trend_description STRING);
